FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE STATIC RELATIVE POSITION

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Watonwan Farm Service Co
PO Box 68
Truman, MN  56088

RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

1. THE FACILITY POLICY

     THE OWNERS, MANAGEMENT, AND EMPLOYEES OF WATONWAN FARM SERVICE CO, Winnebago location, ARE COMMITTED TO THE PREVENTION OF ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASES OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.  IF AN ACCIDENTAL RELEASE SHOULD OCCUR, THE FACILITY IS PREPARED TO WORK WITH THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT, OR OTHER AUTHORITIES, TO MITIGATE ANY RELEASE AND MINIMIZE THE IMPACT OF THE RELEASE TO PEOPLE AND THE ENVIRNOMENT.

2.  FACILITY INFORMATION

      - THE PRIMARY ACTIVITY AT THE FACLITY IS THE STORAGE AND BLENDING OF FERTILIZERS
     FOR SALE TO FARMERS.

      - ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IS RECEIVED, STORED, AND DISTRIBUTED FOR DIRECT APPLICATION.

      - THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY STORED WOULD BE 210,000 POUNDS IN OUR ONE 30,000 GALLON
     AND ONE 18,000 GALLON ANHYDOUS AMMONIA STORAGE.

3. THE WORST CASE RELEASE SCENARIO AND THE ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIO.

    A. THE WORST CASE RELEASE SCENARIO FOR ANHYDROUS AMMONIA WOULD BE THE RELEASE 
    OF THE TOTAL CONTENTS OF A STORAGE TANK RELEASED AS A GAS OVER 10 MINUTES
    THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY RELEASED WOULD BE 130,000  POUNDS, WHICH REPRESENTS THE
    VOLUME OF THE LARGEST STORAGE TANK AT 85 PERCENT CAPACITY AS LIMITED BY DESIGN STANDARDS.
    THE DISTANCE TO THE ENDPOINT {POINT OF DISPERSION TO 200 PPM) IS 1.12 MILES.
        
    B. THE ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIO FOR ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IS BASED ON A 2 MINUTE
   RELEASE FROM A 3 INCH PIPE BREAK. THE DISTANCE TO THE ENDPOINT (POINT OF DISPERSION TO
   200 PPM) IS .78 MILES.
        
4. THE ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM.

             THE FACILITY HAS IMPLEMENTED THE PROVISIONS OF "SAFETY REQUIREMENTS FOR THE
   STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA, K-61.1", PUBLISHED BY THE AMERICAN
   NATIONAL STANDARDS INSTITUTE, INC., AND THE STANDARDS OF THE U.S. OCCUPATIONAL
   SAFETY AND HEALTH ADMINISTRATION (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, " STORAGE AND HANDLING
   OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA".

IN ADDITION, THE MINNESOTA DEPT. OF AGRICULTURE AMMONIA
   RULES. THIS FACILITY COMPLIES WITH EPA'S ACCIDENT PREVENTION RULE AND ALL APPLICABLE
   STATE AND LOCAL CODES AND REGULATIONS.


5. THE FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

             a. THERE HAVE BEEN NO ACCIDENTAL RELEASES OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA OR PROPANE
        IN THE PAST FIVE YEARS THAT:
             -  HAVE CAUSED ANY DEATHS, INJURIES, OR SIGNIFICANT PROPERTY DAMAGE AT THE 
                FACILITY; NOR
             -  TO OUR KNOWLEDGE HAVE RESULTED IN OFFSITE DEATHS, INJURIES, EVACUATIONS,
                SHELTERING IN PLACE, PROPERTY DAMAGE, OR ENVIRONMENTAL DAMAGE.

6. THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM.

             - THE FACILITY HAS:
           
              a.  A WRITTEN EMERGENCY ACTION PLAN, IN ACCORDANCE WITH OSHA STANDARD,
                   29 CFR 1910.38;
              b.  PROVIDED STATE AND LOCAL AUTHORITIES THE EMERGENCY PLANNING AND 
                   COMMUNITY RIGHT TO KNOW INFORMATION AS REQUIRED UNDER SARA TITLE III (EPCRA);
              c.  COORDINATE WITH EMERGENCY RESPONDERS.

7.  PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

SAFETY IMPROVEMENT IS AN ON-GOING PROCESS AT THE FACILITY.
